result.execSummary:
The defendant Damien M. Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Damien M. Johnson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Damien M. Johnson was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Counseling shall specifically include:  Anger management / DV counseling.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
*   Pay restitution in the sum of $18432.34 plus surcharges Joint & Severally w/ David W 12CF431.
May not have contact with David W, Nancy H, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney R Keller.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 4 years w/conditions concurrent to IL sentence; deft to pay $250 DNA surcharge; restitution ordered in the amount of $18,432.34 (by stipulation of deft), joint & several with David W. 12CF431.  No contact w/David W., Nancy H.
For Restitution Order

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney R Keller.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, cts 2 & 3 are dismissed.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 1/20/17 at 9am.  Bond continued.
From DA regarding additional Discovery
